detaileddescription.para: Main parts of FT810 memory map
FT810 register addresses

briefdescription.para: Write 1 byte (8 bits) to FT8xx memory.
Write 2 bytes (16 bits) to FT8xx memory.
Write 4 bytes (32 bits) to FT8xx memory.
Read 1 byte (8 bits) from FT8xx memory.
Read 2 bytes (16 bits) from FT8xx memory.
Read 4 bytes (32 bits) from FT8xx memory.
Execute a display list command by co-processor engine.
Start a new display list.
Swap the current display list.

memberdef.argsstring: (int16_t x, int16_t y, int16_t font, uint16_t options, const char *s)
memberdef.name: cmd_text

briefdescription.para: Draw text.

detaileddescription.para: By default (x,y) is the top-left pixel of the text and the value of options is zero. OPT_CENTERX centers the text horizontally, OPT_CENTERY centers it vertically. OPT_CENTER centers the text in both directions. OPT_RIGHTX right-justifies the text, so that the x is the rightmost pixel.

parameterdescription.para: x-coordinate of text base, in pixels
y-coordinate of text base, in pixels
Font to use for text, 0-31. 16-31 are ROM fonts
Character string to display, terminated with a null character

memberdef.argsstring: (int16_t x, int16_t y, int16_t font, uint16_t options, int32_t n)
memberdef.name: cmd_number

briefdescription.para: Draw a decimal number.

detaileddescription.para: By default (x, y) is the top-left pixel of the text. OPT_CENTERX centers the text horizontally, OPT_CENTERY centers it vertically. OPT_CENTER centers the text in both directions. OPT_RIGHTX right-justifies the text, so that the x is the rightmost pixel. By default the number is displayed with no leading zeroes, but if a width 1-9 is specified in the options, then the number is padded if necessary with leading zeroes so that it has the given width. If OPT_SIGNED is given, the number is treated as signed, and prefixed by a minus sign if negative.

parameterdescription.para: x-coordinate of text base, in pixels
y-coordinate of text base, in pixels
Font to use for text, 0-31. 16-31 are ROM fonts

briefdescription.para: Execute the touch screen calibration routine.

detaileddescription.para: The calibration procedure collects three touches from the touch screen, then computes and loads an appropriate matrix into REG_TOUCH_TRANSFORM_A-F. To use it, create a display list and then use CMD_CALIBRATE. The co-processor engine overlays the touch targets on the current display list, gathers the calibration input and updates REG_TOUCH_TRANSFORM_A-F.

parameterdescription.para: Calibration result, written with 0 on failure of calibration

detaileddescription.para: Co-processor widget is drawn in 3D effect
Co-processor option to decode the JPEG image to RGB565 format
Co-processor option to decode the JPEG image to L8 format, i.e., monochrome
No display list commands generated for bitmap decoded from JPEG image
Co-processor widget is drawn without 3D effect
The number is treated as 32 bit signed integer
Co-processor widget centers horizontally
Co-processor widget centers vertically
Co-processor widget centers horizontally and vertically
The label on the Coprocessor widget is right justified
Co-processor widget has no background drawn
Co-processor clock widget is drawn without hour ticks. Gauge widget is drawn without major and minor ticks.
Co-processor clock widget is drawn without hour and minutes hands, only seconds hand is drawn
The Co-processor gauge has no pointer
Co-processor clock widget is drawn without seconds hand
Co-processor clock widget is drawn without hour, minutes and seconds hands
Rectangular pixel arrays, in various color formats
Anti-aliased points, point radius is 1-256 pixels
Anti-aliased lines, with width from 0 to 4095 1/16th of pixel units. (width is from center of the line to boundary)
Anti-aliased lines, connected head-to-tail
Edge strips for right
Edge strips for left
Edge strips for above
Edge strips for below
Round-cornered rectangles, curvature of the corners can be adjusted using LINE_WIDTH

briefdescription.para: Begin drawing a graphics primitive.

detaileddescription.para:
The valid primitives are defined as:
BITMAPS
POINTS
LINES
LINE_STRIP
EDGE_STRIP_R
EDGE_STRIP_L
EDGE_STRIP_A
EDGE_STRIP_B
RECTS
The primitive to be drawn is selected by the BEGIN command. Once the primitive is selected, it will be valid till the new primitive is selected by the BEGIN command.

simplesect.para: The primitive drawing operation will not be performed until VERTEX2II or VERTEX2F is executed.

briefdescription.para: Clear buffers to preset values.

detaileddescription.para: Setting c to true will clear the color buffer of the FT8xx to the preset value. Setting this bit to false will maintain the color buffer of the FT8xx with an unchanged value. The preset value is defined in command CLEAR_COLOR_RGB for RGB channel and CLEAR_COLOR_A for alpha channel.

Setting s to true will clear the stencil buffer of the FT8xx to the preset value. Setting this bit to false will maintain the stencil buffer of the FT8xx with an unchanged value. The preset value is defined in command CLEAR_STENCIL.

Setting t to true will clear the tag buffer of the FT8xx to the preset value. Setting this bit to false will maintain the tag buffer of the FT8xx with an unchanged value. The preset value is defined in command CLEAR_TAG.

briefdescription.para: Specify clear values for red, green and blue channels.

detaileddescription.para: Sets the color values used by a following CLEAR.

parameterdescription.para: Red value used when the color buffer is cleared
Green value used when the color buffer is cleared
Blue value used when the color buffer is cleared

briefdescription.para: Set the current color red, green and blue.

detaileddescription.para: Sets red, green and blue values of the FT8xx color buffer which will be applied to the following draw operation.

parameterdescription.para: Red value for the current color
Green value for the current color
Blue value for the current color

briefdescription.para: End the display list.

detaileddescription.para: FT8xx will ignore all the commands following this command.

briefdescription.para: End drawing a graphics primitive.

detaileddescription.para: It is recommended to have an END for each BEGIN. Whereas advanced users can avoid the usage of END in order to save extra graphics instructions in the display list RAM.

briefdescription.para: Specify the width of lines to be drawn with primitive LINES.

detaileddescription.para: Sets the width of drawn lines. The width is the distance from the center of the line to the outermost drawn pixel, in units of 1/16 pixel. The valid range is from 16 to 4095 in terms of 1/16th pixel units.

simplesect.para: The LINE_WIDTH command will affect the LINES, LINE_STRIP, RECTS, EDGE_STRIP_A /B/R/L primitives.

briefdescription.para: Attach the tag value for the following graphics objects.

detaileddescription.para: The initial value of the tag buffer of the FT8xx is specified by command CLEAR_TAG and taken effect by command CLEAR. TAG command can specify the value of the tag buffer of the FT8xx that applies to the graphics objects when they are drawn on the screen. This TAG value will be assigned to all the following objects, unless the TAG_MASK command is used to disable it. Once the following graphics objects are drawn, they are attached with the tag value successfully. When the graphics objects attached with the tag value are touched, the register REG_TOUCH_TAG will be updated with the tag value of the graphics object being touched. If there is no TAG commands in one display list, all the graphics objects rendered by the display list will report tag value as 255 in REG_TOUCH_TAG when they were touched.

briefdescription.para: Start the operation of graphics primitives at the specified coordinate.

detaileddescription.para: The range of coordinates is from -16384 to +16383 in terms of 1/16th pixel units. The negative x coordinate value means the coordinate in the left virtual screen from (0, 0), while the negative y coordinate value means the coordinate in the upper virtual screen from (0, 0). If drawing on the negative coordinate position, the drawing operation will not be visible.

briefdescription.para: Start the operation of graphics primitive at the specified coordinates.

detaileddescription.para: The valid range of handle is from 0 to 31. From 16 to 31 the bitmap handle is dedicated to the FT8xx built-in font.
Cell number is the index of bitmap with same bitmap layout and format. For example, for handle 31, the cell 65 means the character "A" in the largest built in font.

briefdescription.para: FT8xx reference API.

detaileddescription.para: API defined according to FT800 Programmers Guide API reference definition.

simplesect.para: Function names defined in this header may easily collide with names provided by other modules. Include this header with caution. If naming conflict occurs instead of including this header, use ft8xx_ prefixed names.
